intro: Espeletia steyermarkii, commonly known as the cloud forest heather, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, showy flower heads that bloom in the spring and summer months. It thrives in cool, humid environments with well-drained soil. Espeletia steyermarkii is often found in cloud forests, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
